TITLE: Economists are divided on the risk of a U.S. recession. And the jobs data isn't helping
SUMMARY: "We're coming out of an extraordinary period that's not been seen before in history," Moody's William Foster told CNBC.

TITLE: Falling gas prices are raising hopes that inflation is slowing, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: Respondents to the New York Fed survey indicated they expect the annual inflation rate to be 5.7% a year from now.

TITLE: Inflation isn't just about fuel costs anymore, as price increases broaden across the economy
SUMMARY: Rather than fuel, it was food, shelter and medical services that drove costs higher in August, slapping a costly tax on those least able to afford it.

TITLE: Inflation rose 0.1% in August even with sharp drop in gas prices
SUMMARY: The consumer price index for August was expected to decrease 0.1% from the previous month and increase 8% from a year ago, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: The Fed is going to pivot in 3 stages, author Nomi Prins says
SUMMARY: The U.S. Federal Reserve could be forced to pivot away from its path of aggressive interest rate hikes in three stages, according to author Nomi Prins.

TITLE: Wholesale prices fell 0.1% in August amid inflation fears
SUMMARY: The producer price index, a gauge of prices received at the wholesale level, declined 0.1%, according to a Bureau of Labor Statistics report.

TITLE: Retail sales growth sluggish in August as consumers fight to keep up with inflation
SUMMARY: Advance retail sales for the month increased 0.3% from July, better than the Dow Jones estimate for no change.

TITLE: ‘The economy is braking hard’ and CEO confidence is miserable, says billionaire investor Barry Sternlicht
SUMMARY: The economy is on the brink of a serious downturn if the Fed doesn't pump the brakes on its rate hikes, billionaire CEO Barry Sternlicht said.

TITLE: Here’s why Hispanic workers could face an outsized hit in a U.S. recession
SUMMARY: Hispanic workers have been disproportionately affected by past recessions and the next one will likely be no different, according to Wells Fargo.
